d.name: Citadel Guard
d.phase: Hello Stranger ... Unfortunately the King can't see you at the moment he's too busy trying to steal some lodestone,

d.name: Rockies King
d.phase: You explain that you've been attacked by ferocious Wanwans ... After questioning you, the guards finally grant you an audience with the King, his highness Rocky IV.

Welcome Dinoz Master ... It appears you are not a native of the Magnetic Steppes. We appreciate you taking such a long journey to come and see us. Please forgive us for not welcoming you with the usual level of hospitality as the rest of our guests, but recent events have left us exhausted.
It's no secret that the Royal Family controls all of this region. The power was bestowed on us by previous generations of the Grand-Heavy-Sharp, The Lodestone Tamer.
Lodestone is a type of stone which can only be found at the Steppes ... When combined with wind and sand, lodestone can produce electricity!

In it's natural state, Lodestone is very unstable and hard to control. The Grand-Heavy-Sharp has discovered a perfectly pure stone: The Angel Stone. The heirs to the Royal Family must protect it in order to keep it away of villains.
Recently ... someone tried to steal the Angel Stone!!! It's a difficult job, but we must protect it at all costs! The Royal Family's honour is at stake ... Do you understand?
d.a: Can you repeat it for me?
What's it got to do with me?
d.phase: Hold on! I'm getting there! You see, bandits are running wild in the Lodestone Steppes. We've seen some of them prowling around the castle. They're the same ones which attacked you near the Syphon. They call themselves Team-W.

Yes ... Team-W are a strange-looking group of nomads who are controlling some Wanwans. We think they are the same ones who tried to steal our Angel Stone. We've sent our soldiers to look for them, and managed to injure their leader, but we don't know where they're hiding....

We had to recall our soldiers in order to protect the Angel Stone. We don't know where or when the enemy will strike time ... Can we trust you with finding and destroying Team-W? You'll be royally rewarded for your efforts!
d.a: Yes! it would be an honour!
d.phase: We understand, there's no need to involve you in something which you are not responsible for. We wish you a safe journey in the Magnetic Steppes, come back if you change your mind....

Really? You will be of great help to us young Dinoz Master! Our counsellors will show you the secret path. This will allow you to access to the Extreme West where the Bandit's lair is located. Our Highness wishes you good luck. We hope to hear some good news soon!
One of the King's counsellors shows you the path, granting you access to the bandits' lair. He warns you about the dangers which may await you. Be well prepared!

d.name: Strange Prowler
d.phase: Have I been spotted??? .....
Before you have approached, the Prowler has misteriously disappeared. What is he up to....

d.name: Captain
d.phase: Why did you attack us? Were you trying to get your revenge? I thought we already apologised for attacking you?
Sorry, you're right, I haven't introduced myself. My name is Muldern, I'm the captain of Team-W ... Who sent you and why did you attack us?
d.a: Tell him that the Rockies King sent you
d.phase: I see ... you don't want to talk ... you must be one of his spies! I'm going to ask you for the last time: Who sent you? and why are we being targetted by the King?
I see ... if you have nothing to say, leave! We can withstand the King's attacks for months, nothing is going to make us surrender!

You spend the next hour telling the captain everything that has happened since you entered the Magnetic Steppes. You tell him about Team-W's attack, the audience with the King and of course the plot to take some Lodestone.
Ah, now I understand. Some days ago, our strongest Wanwan, Bigbeastly - the one you tried to fight outside - was poisoned by a strange substance.

Of course we investigated to see how it happened. We found a secret path during our investigation which led us all the way to the Rockies King's Citadel. That's why we're watching it so closely: we were searching for a way to cure Bigbeastly.
I can swear that we never planned to take any Lodestone. This stone is of no importance for us nomads, we already have everything we right here at the steppes....

We're often treated like thieves, often because people mix us up with the bandits of the Extreme West! We often find them here and end up fighting ... although they hate us, the inhabitants often help us as the King never sends any soldiers here ... they're too scared by the Huge Worm ... It seems the Nomads have been abandoned by the King.
That's everything I have to tell you. Do you need me to repeat it?
d.a: Yes please, I didn't understand a single thing
d.phase: I'm very sorry for everyhting that has happened ... but you must understand, we have to cure Bigbeastly ... he is getting weaker by the day and we fear the worst for him. You're in contact with the King, do you think you could help us plead our cause? It's simply a big misunderstanding, and he'll be able to help us find the cause of the poisoning.
I understand ... come back if you change your mind though.
... Really? You'll do that for us, even though we attacked you? ... may the Huge Worm watch over you! Take care, there may be bandits on the road ... we look forward to hearing from you!

d.name: Captain
d.phase: Have you seen the King? Do you know how to cure Bigbeastly? ... We're all counting on you, make sure youn return with some good news!

d.name: Rockies King
d.phase: You're already back young Dinoz Master? We hope you return with good news.
Well then! tell us of your travels.
You explain to the Rockies King your meeting with the Team-W Captain, his story concerning Bigbeastly's poisoning, and his innoncence for the Lodestone thefts. The King listens to you in silence ....

Well well ... You'll understand if we can't trust these strange people immediately. It requires further investigation. Meanwhile, we'd like you to carry out another service for us, if you have enough time.
Yes exactly. A service. These rumours of someone being poisoned worry us greatly. We must be prepared for the worse. If our information is right, it can be SEDH Active.

SEDH is a very strong poison that can only be found at the Magnetic Steppes. It is created by concentrating Scorpwink poison and adding a secret ingredient which activates hidden powers. Our army has been forbidden from producing Sehd, as once activated one can use it to take control of the poisoned man or Dinoz....

Yes, that's right. Whoever is under control of SEDH Active can't think normally and even betrays his friends... SEDH was banned from the kingdom a long time ago by our ancestors. If it is SEDH Active, we must find out who is producing it and stop them as soon as possible.

We would like you to go and gather some ingredients for us. Once these ingredients have been gathered together, you will be able to concoct an Anti SEDH Potion that will cure the effects of the poison.

Yes. According to our legends, three ingredients are needed: Coral that never breaks, Ice that never melts, and Branch that never fade. Once this three ingredients have been gathered together, you must find an Antique Monkey....

It was either an Antique Sage or an Antique Monkey, we can't remember than well. In any case, they are very powerful people who can live for many centuries! We recognise them because of their third eye that they use to look at the other side of Dinoland....

Yes ... legend tells that Dinoland has another side, a dark side. We call this place the Dark World. No one has ever returned after venturing there ... but Antique Sages (or Monkeys?) can freely travel in the Dark World ... but we doubt this information can be used to find this person....

Anyway, his Highness is counting on you to gather these three ingredients, find the Antique Monkey, and bring us the Anti SEDH Potion as soon as possible, which will protect us against the poison ... As for the nomads, we will investigate and verify their words ... Your audience with the King has ended. Goodbye.
You are on the road again for new adventures....

d.name: Captain
d.phase: Stranger!! Quick! The King is being attacked by strong creatures, they are trying to poison him and take control of the Royal Stone! Can you help us defeat them?
Be quick! We really need your help!
Thanks for your help... After you left, the dark Smashrooms took Bigbeastly away. It looks like the poison they were using allowed them to control him...
They then used Bigbeastly's strength to attack the Royal Citadel and make off with the magnetite... Fortunately we got there just in time...
d.a: Thanks for your help in the battle!
d.phase: No problem, that"s just how I roll, we couldn't just let Bigbeastly destroy everything. It's all thanks to your potion that we managed to do it...
We took him back to our campsite. He's in some mess, but he'll make it though... thanks to you...
It was above and beyond the call of duty. It seems the Great Worm was watching over you... Come and see us any time at the campsite, we'll let you use our secret shop...
The captain sets off towards the Team-W campsite...

d.name: Captain
d.phase: Thanks for your help... After you left, the dark Smashrooms took Bigbeastly away. It looks like the poison they were using allowed them to control him...
They then used Bigbeastly's strength to attack the Royal Citadel and make off with the magnetite... Fortunately we got there just in time...

d.phase: No problem, that"s just how I roll, we couldn't just let Bigbeastly destroy everything. It's all thanks to your potion that we managed to do it...
We took him back to our campsite. He's in some mess, but he'll make it though... thanks to you...
It was above and beyond the call of duty. It seems the Great Worm was watching over you... Come and see us any time at the campsite, we'll let you use our secret shop...
The captain sets off towards the Team-W campsite...

d.name: Rockies King
d.phase: Young Dinoz master! We're very happy that this problem has now been solved ... we want to thank you for the many services you have done for the Royal Family, whilst risking your own life....
With these events, we were able to reconcile with the extreme West nomads ... We will be more attentive to our distant subjects, because it seems that our mind on them was a bit hasty.

We insist that we must reward you correctly. Thanks to you, we've captured some infamous dark Smashrooms who, it seems, were responsible for stealing the Lodestone, making SEDH Active, Bigbeastly poisoning and the Citadel attack ... what a machiavellian plan!!
But don't worry, all the suspects have been locked up in our jail, and they won't be released for a long time, you have our Royal word....
Well well, as a thank you for all your services, we have prepared a little reward ... a royal one! We hope that you accept it as a sign of our gratitude....
d.a: Of course I accept it, thanks very much
d.phase: Here you go ... we entrust you with this Negative Lodestone Shard. It can cancel the Lodestone effect in certain areas. It's a very rare item and we hope that it helps you in your future journeys.
The Rockies King has entrusted you with the following item: "The Negative Lodestone Shard". But what is it used for?

d.name: Strange Prowler
d.phase: So that was you.......
Yes! More than foiling my plan, you've pursues me and now you think you can stop me?
I won't forget about this! Now I have to return to report to the Caushmesh Masters ... You're lucky I'm in such a hurry, next time we meet, I'll make you pay for your acts!
The Prowler has mysteriously disappeared ... he seemed extremely angry with you....
